title: INtopBackup
description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

items.title: VIDEO: Trump and scientists disagree on Tylenol and autism. Who do Americans believe?

items.title: Leucovorin for autism? Many scientists — and parents — are skeptical
items.description: President Trump says an old drug that acts like a vitamin can reduce autism symptoms in many children. The science doesn't support that claim.

items.title: RadioShack buyers ran a Ponzi scheme, SEC alleges
items.description: The buyers of distressed brick-and-mortar companies like RadioShack and Modell's Sporting Goods, are accused of running a Ponzi scheme.

items.title: Australian film altered in China to make gay couple straight
items.description: A scene featuring a same-sex couple was digitally altered to depict a heterosexual couple.

items.title: U.S. GDP expanded at a surprising 3.8% pace in 2nd-quarter revision
items.description: The U.S. economy's 3.8% growth from April through June represents a dramatic upgrade of the government's previous estimate.

items.title: Former French president Sarkozy given five-year sentence after Libya case
items.description: Nicolas Sarkozy, president from 2007-12, was found guilty of criminal conspiracy but cleared of other charges.

items.title: Lice concerns rise with kids at school. What to know about prevention, treatment.
items.description: Lice cannot hop, jump or fly. The most common way to get lice is through head-to-head contact with someone who already has them, according to experts.

items.title: Over 1,000 children fall ill from free school lunches in Indonesia
items.description: The government's multi-billion-dollar "nutritious meals programme" has been plagued by food poisoning.

items.title: Palestinians in West Bank stranded as Israel shuts only international crossing
items.description: Many have been unable to leave the territory since the Allenby Bridge crossing was shut indefinitely on Wednesday.
